page.title: 12Oil Seed Rape
page.content: The first type Oil Seed Rape is the one mainly grown in the British Isles. The minute seed is planted in well prepared ground in August; by December it has grown approx. 38_46cms. It is susceptible to extreme frost, but of more concern are the pigeons, they can quickly destroy a crop even when they do not particularly like it, but have nothing else to eat, a deterrent "gas banger" is used which is let off at intervals, any time of between 4 minutes and 40 minutes. Growth restarts in February/March time and by May when the flowers appear the plant stands 120-160cms high, growth is roughly 15cms per week. Although supposedly self-pollinating sun is appreciated during this four week flowering period, for the bees to assist the process, and from June onwards to
